circumstances: The pilot, sole on board, was performing a ferry flight from Honolulu to Van Nuys, California. While cruising along the coast of the Maui Island, both engines failed simultaneously. Unable to maintain a safe altitude, he ditched the aircraft 22 miles offshore. The pilot was rescued while the aircraft sank and was lost.
probable_cause:
Double engine failure in flight following a fuel exhaustion. The following factors were reported:
- Inadequate preflight preparation, 
- Improper in-flight decisions, 
- Mismanagement of fuel, 
- Miscalculated fuel consumption, 
- Fuel exhaustion, 
- Pilot became lost/disoriented, 
- HF communication inoperative.
